attributes.comment:
I am writing to voice my very strong objections to the proposal to raise filing fees
with USCIS. I am an adoptive parent of a child from China and am currently
waiting to adopt my second child. If the proposed rule is adopted, filing fees would
increase by an average of 66% over current fees. Adoption is expensive enough
already, and it is unconscionable to raise fees by up to 66% for adoption-related
petitions. Because we have to file an I-600 A at the beginning of the process and
the wait has gotten so long, we will most likely have to file a second time and/or
have to get fingerprinted a second time because the wait has gotten so long and
our currently approved petition will expire before we can complete the adoption. To
raise the fees on top of having to pay them twice is absolutely outrageous!
Please. please, please put a stop to this nonsense! This is punishing families
who are simply trying to make a difference in the lives of abandoned children, while
adding to their families. I'm very concerned that this will create a huge financial
hardship to our family as well as many other families who care about children.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jill Horton
